page.title: 19Children's Writing
page.content: "... Now for the interviews, bring cassette recorders, knock on people's doors, ask them little questions like 'Do you have a car or use the public transport?' 'Do you keep a pet, and if so more than one?' Arrange some time to interview a shopkeeper or two ... Afterwards back to the same old school, where we interpret our notes, and write them out neatly to put in our folders, and then type them on to a computer disk, write them again to photocopy and send them to people we interviewed." (Sonia Bruce, 10) { "Bells Yew Green is an attractive {place, Countryside lanes and views {which look for miles. Over the week {we had lots of fun visiting people, {The minibus driving for miles and {miles, In the back you could see the {children's smiles... " (Richard Candler, 11)
